title: STUDENT ACTIVITIES
content: Students of the D3 Road Transportation Management program actively engage in activities that support academic competence and practical skills development. These activities include traffic management simulations, field visits to terminals, inland ports, and logistics companies, as well as training in transportation management software. Students also participate in seminars, workshops, and competitions related to transportation innovation. Community service activities, such as safe driving campaigns, provide opportunities for students to contribute directly to society. Through these activities, students not only deepen their theoretical understanding but also enhance their practical abilities.
